title: Banana Muffins Recipe
description: These banana muffins are deliciously moist and tender. Made with ripe mashed bananas and simple pantry ingredients ‚Äî they are easy for kids to make!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe:¬†Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Bread Quick Bread Recipes Muffin Recipes Banana Muffin Recipes Banana Muffins 4.8 (5,115) 4,133 Reviews 1,162 Photos These banana muffins are moist and delicious. This is an easy recipe for kids to help make and perfect for using up ripe bananas. They're wonderful as-is or with walnuts or chocolate chips. Submitted by ABI_GODFREY Updated on September 30, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 1,162 1,162 1,162 1,162 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 muffins Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Start your day in the most delicious way: With homemade banana muffins! This banana muffin recipe is beloved by the Allrecipes community because it's quick, delicious, and easy to customize. How to Make Banana Muffins You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Banana Muffins Ingredients These are the ingredients you'll need to make this top-rated banana muffin recipe: Flour: All-purpose flour adds structure to the banana muffin batter.Leaveners: Baking soda and baking powder act as leaveners, which means they help the muffins rise.Salt: A pinch of salt enhances the flavors of the other ingredients.Bananas: Of course, you'll need mashed bananas!Sugar: White sugar sweetens things up a bit.Egg: An egg binds the muffin batter together and lends moisture.Butter: Melted butter adds even more moisture and richness. Recipe Tip Want to customize this banana muffin recipe? Optional mix-ins include chocolate chips, walnuts, pecans, oats, chia seeds, pumpkin seeds, and dried fruit. How to Make Banana Muffins From-Scratch Here's a very brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade banana muffins: Sift the dry ingredients together in one bowl. Mix the wet ingredients in another bowl.Fold the dry mixture into the wet mixture.Spoon the batter into prepared muffin tins. Bake the muffins in the preheated oven. How Long to Bake Banana Muffins In an oven preheated to 350 degrees F, a dozen banana muffins should be fully baked in 25 to 30 minutes. You'll know they're done when the top springs back when lightly pressed. If you make mini muffins, decrease the baking time to 10 to 15 minutes. How to Store Banana Muffins Line an airtight storage container or zip-top bag with paper towels. Store the banana muffins in a single layer for up to four days. Learn more: How to Store Muffins to Keep Them Fresh Can You Freeze Banana Muffins? Yes! Banana muffins freeze well. Wrap each muffin in storage wrap or foil, then transfer them to a zip-top freezer bag or another freezer-safe container. Freeze for two months. Thaw at room temperature or gently microwave them. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise These are my go-to muffins and I have been making this recipe for years," raves Shelby Bourbonnais, who adds chocolate chips and vanilla extract. "They are easy, moist, and delicious!" "Love this recipe," says one Allrecipes community member. "Doubt I'll ever use a different one. I use it for muffins and loafs alike. Great with walnuts and/or chocolate chips." "This is a great recipe," according to Glenn Melton. "I added a half teaspoon of almond extract and a cup of walnuts. Love it with a cup of coffee." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 ¬Ω cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking powder 1 teaspoon baking soda ¬Ω teaspoon salt 3 large ripe bananas, mashed ¬æ cup white sugar 1 large egg ‚Öì cup butter, melted Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl; set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix bananas, sugar, egg, and melted butter in a separate large bowl until well combined; fold in flour mixture until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 25 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cool briefly in the tin, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 8,539 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Banana Muffins 01 of 1,162 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 1,162 Photo by¬† Milo Enterlein 04/04/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite 03 of 1,162 Photo by¬† Melissa 03/15/2025 This recipe is a good one, however it is lacking vanilla. I doubled the recipe and followed exactly as written in the recipe, then I added a heaping teaspoon of Vanilla Paste to the banana mixture before folding into flour mixture and it made a WORLD of difference. But I‚Äôm a retired pastry chef and my personal preference is that 99% of baked goods require vanilla. You just cannot make something as delicious as a banana muffin without it. I also stopped using extract and started using homemade vanilla paste a few years ago, this also leveled up everything I bake. I went ahead and folded in some Dark Chocolate Chunks & Chopped Walnuts for some texture, this also leveled up these muffins! This recipe doubled made 14 jumbo muffins. If I had not added in the Chocolate and Nuts it probably would have made exactly 12. The temperature and bake time was spot on. 350 for 25 minutes for the win. 04 of 1,162 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 03/13/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow I have been trying to find a way to sneak bananas into my daughters diet. No particular reason besides being healthy and balanced like the pediatrician's say. She "hates" banana bread. My other loves banana's, but cant eat them fast enough. So I decided to give this recipe a shot. I followed this recipe to a T, until the very end. Once everything in the recipe was ready to be placed in the muffin tin, I folded in a handful of chocolate chips (irresistible to kids) and a sprinkle of light brown sugar on top for a smell disguise. It works!! Kids ate them up without thinking twice! Not sure if it's healthy with my additions, but it's the thought that counts ;-) 05 of 1,162 Photo by¬† ZippyYam7846 12/19/2024 Easy to follow Worth the effort A keeper! This recipe is very easy to make. I sifted all dry ingredients, and added 1 tbsp of vanilla extract, and substituted unsweetened applesauce for some of the sugar (instead of 3/4 cup white sugar, I used 1/4 cup sugar and 1/2 cup of applesauce) and the muffins turned out extremely moist.When making this recipe, be precise in the measurements of ingredients, and do not over mix the ingredients.I have made this recipe twice in one week, they were that good. :-) Highly recommend. 06 of 1,162 Photo by¬† trisha 10/25/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Great flavors So easy to make. Taste great . I made these a few times I just made them tonight but as a cake and swirled some nutella in them !! yum 07 of 1,162 Photo by¬† OrangeThyme2283 10/12/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Loved it I used Self raising flour and added an extra egg when I saw there was not enough liquid in the recipe. They came out perfectly üëå I made 6 large ones 08 of 1,162 Photo by¬† Michelle Johnson Downey 10/07/2024 Loved how easy it was, and I doubled the batch using frozen bananas that I thawed . Very tasty. I ate 2 . 09 of 1,162 Photo by¬† NewMelon4148 09/26/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort 10 of 1,162 Photo by¬† CoralBacon2076 09/01/2024 Easy to follow A keeper! Worth the effort I don‚Äôt like cinnamon and spices so this is the perfect recipe for me. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Banana Crumb Muffins 14,709 Ratings Sarah's Banana Bread Muffins 1,072 Ratings Banana Oat Muffins 1,644 Ratings Mocha Chocolate Chip Banana Muffins 739 Ratings Health Nut Blueberry Muffins 878 Ratings Gluten-Free Vegan Banana Bread Muffins 3 Ratings Banana Muffins with a Crunch 350 Ratings Fluffy Glazed Banana Muffins Banana Oat Muffins with Sour Cream 333 Ratings Best Bake Sale Banana Muffins 1 Rating Janet's Rich Banana Bread 10,668 Ratings Pumpkin Apple Streusel Muffins 1,231 Ratings Banana Sour Cream Bread 5,958 Ratings Extreme Banana Nut Bread 'EBNB' 2,847 Ratings Most Requested Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins 114 Ratings Whole30 Banana Bread Drop Muffins 68 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
